topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538a923a6368724d11290300#post_538a923a6368724d11290300
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538a93486368724e61bc0300#post_538a93486368724e61bc0300

I can at least understand the motivation of luddites and anti science people of all stripes, even if I refuse to share them.

Progress is terrifying. It cuts deep, it bleeds us and progress does not proceed in nice symmetrical lines for all aspects of society, worse still no one ever 100% agrees on what form of progress is desirable.

Add to it the fact that its all an utter crap shoot. The hope of the future, the thing we desperately need to be a bright shining beacon leading us to a better tomorrow could turn out to just be a the lure of an as yet unknown horror which ushers in death and destruction on scales we can scarcely imagine.

Think of all the things people invented that they'd hoped would stop war by bringing humanity closer together, all of which went onto become tools of war in their own right, one of them, the airplane even delivering the only two wartime uses of the most horrific strain of weapon we've ever conceived, bombs that annihilated hundreds of thousands and etched their very shadows onto the ground.

And yet we have to keep going because stagnation is worse. Trust once more in the unknown, or stay put and allow millions to starve, allow others to be beaten down, allow the world to grind us all into pulp.

"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538a95c86368724eeb430400#post_538a95c86368724eeb430400
Humans are much sturdier than you think. We're like rats in all the best possible ways, we go everywhere, fuck constantly and we can survive on more or less anything. When we eat stuff our bodies don't check where it came from, they just get to the business of breaking it all down into useful parts.

So long as synthetic meat or whatever else people are freaking out about is not actually poisonous we'll be fine.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538a999f6368724c30ab0600#post_538a999f6368724c30ab0600

topics.body:
Why don't anyone in the US eat those Asian Carps and snakehead fishes that are infesting the rivers such as the Mississippi, more?
They're good fish, a delicacy in Chinese cuisine. In fact, they are over-fished, and endangered in their native range.

"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538a9bff63687238ba9f0000#post_538a9bff63687238ba9f0000
Western culture. The same reason people here will not eat horses; they find that kind of meat revolting and unappetizing.

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538a9f3063687238cfe30100#post_538a9f3063687238cfe30100
Taste is one thing. Culture, and religious dietary laws may also pay big parts in what people eat. From what I know, most insects aren't Halal nor Kosher, save for a few such as certain locust species. Jainists don't eat animals at all.

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538a9a476368723628320000#post_538a9a476368723628320000
The ingredients are not artificial. It may be synthetic meat, but it still contains all the "natural" ingredients, such as proteins. The protein is still made of natural amino acids, not Chemical X or anything. 

It is like eating natural beef, but without the nasty cancer-causing saturated fats and stuff.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538aa2df63687236b9620300#post_538aa2df63687236b9620300
I do like animals but at the same time I don't consider lab grown meat actual meat because it is not real meat. The definition of meat is the muscle tissue of an animal and this did not come from an animal.


"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538aa31363687236cac80300#post_538aa31363687236cac80300
As awful as it may sound, think about it. A human that was bioengineered and was grown in a lab with no natural processes involved. It sounds more like some kind of cyborg or sci-fi thing than what I would consider a person; it's a human created by science, not by biology.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538aa50963687235fe5f0400#post_538aa50963687235fe5f0400
It is still technically animal tissue.

And the human grown in a lab still has feelings and consciousness. It deserves to be called a person like anyone else.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097
